clinical_study.brief_title: Radiological Measurement of Femoral Stem Version Using Lateral Decubitus Method: A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to develop a radiological method to measure stem anteversion and to determine its validity and reliability.

detailed_description.textblock: Version of the femoral stem is an important factor influencing the risk of dislocation after total hip replacement (THR) as well as the position of the acetabular component. However, there is no radiological method of measuring stem anteversion described in the literature. Investigators propose a radiological method to measure stem version and have assessed its reliability and validity. In 40 patients who underwent THR, a hip radiograph and CT scan were taken to measure stem anteversion.

primary_outcome.measure: stem anteversion of the hip radiograph(decubitus lateral view)
stem anteversion of the CT scan

secondary_outcome.measure: The correlation between stem anteversion of the decubitus lateral view and stem version of the CT scan
secondary_outcome.description: to determine ICC(intraclass coefficient, correlation coefficient)
